contentList.content: Lord Ao has taken a personal interest in your cause and bestowed a piece of His transcendental knowledge upon you.
Adventuring with companions grants you renewed insight on your own abilities.
You've come to understand the interconnectivity of everything. Mastery of one craft leads to mastery of others.
Constant struggles on the edge between life and death have aligned your soul a little bit closer to the Threads of Fate that bind everything in the multiverse.
You have managed to gather a piece of your own essence from every parallel timeline, turning all potentiality into a force that can shape the ultimate reality.
You get daily amount of spell slots equivalent to a full caster (Wizard, Cleric, etc.) of your character level. Stackable.
You get daily amount of spell slots equivalent to a full caster (Wizard, Cleric, etc.) of your character level. Stackable.
You get daily amount of spell slots equivalent to a half caster (Paladin, Ranger, etc.) of your character level. Stackable.
You get daily amount of spell slots equivalent to a third caster (Arcane Trickster, Eldritch Knight, etc.) of your character level. Stackable.
You get daily amount of spell slots equivalent to a half caster (Paladin, Ranger, etc.) of your character level. Stackable.
You get the amount of spell slots of a warlock equivalent to your character level each time you finish a short rest. Stackable.
You get daily amount of spell slots equivalent to a third caster (Arcane Trickster, Eldritch Knight, etc.) of your character level. Stackable.
Your forsake pursuit of magic for the sake of other interests. Stackable.
You get the amount of spell slots of a warlock equivalent to your character level each time you finish a short rest. Stackable.
You are not interested in the powers offered in this list.
Your forsake pursuit of magic for the sake of other interests. Stackable.
You are not interested in the powers offered in this list
You are not interested in the powers offered in this list
You are not interested in the powers offered in this list
Your magic is the testament of your mastery over the laws of the multiverse. You get all baseline wizard spells as you level up.
Your magic flows from the sacred font of light. You get all light domain cleric spells known as you level up.
Your magic flows from the sacred font of guile. You get all trickery domain cleric spells known as you level up.
Your magic flows from the sacred font of divinity. You get all baseline cleric spells known as you level up.
Your magic flows from the sacred font of wilderness. You get all nature domain cleric spells known as you level up.
Your magic flows from the sacred font of wisdom. You get all knowledge domain cleric spells known as you level up.
Your magic flows from the sacred font of storms. You get all tempest domain cleric spells known as you level up.
Your magic flows from the sacred font of battles. You get all war domain cleric spells known as you level up.
Your magic echoes the words of power that speak the cosmos into being. You get all baseline bard spells as you level up.
You are content with the magic already at your disposal. Stackable.
You are content with the magic already at your disposal. Stackable.
Your magic guides you in the pursuit of your mark. You get all baseline ranger spells as you level up.
Your magic assists you in the realization of your sacred oath. You get all baseline paladin spells as you level up.
Your magic grows from the wilderness that encompasses all life. You get all baseline druid spells as you level up.
Your magic comes from the whispers of otherworldly entities. You get all baseline warlock spells as you level up.
Your instincts manifest through untamed fury and violence. You get all Berserker Barbarian abilities as you level up.
Your instincts manifest through a close bond to the wilderness. You get all Wildheart Barbarian abilities as you level up. Select your Wild Heart and Animal Aspects in next sections.
Your instincts manifest through a torrent of chaotic magical energy. You get all Wild Magic Barbarian abilities as you level up.
You do not deem any of these barbaric instincts worthy of development. You get none of the Barbarian abilities as you level up.
You do not feel particular alignment with any of the animals in this list. DO NOT choose this if you have chosen 'Wildheart' in the previous section.
You do not feel particular alignment with any of the animals in this list. DO NOT pick this if you picked 'Wildheart' in the previous section.
The wild nature of animals does not inspire a feeling of rage inside you. DO NOT choose this if you have chosen 'Wildheart' in the previous section.
Other options in this section do not apply to you. Stackable.
Other options in this section do not apply to you. Stackable.
Other options in this section do not apply to you. Stackable.
Your interest lies in wondrous tales and echoes of bygone age. You get all College of Lore Bard abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
Your interest lies in the melodies of clashing steel and the legends of battle heroes. You get all College of Valour Bard abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
Your interest lies in the flourish of blades and graceful manoeuvres. You get all College of Swords Bard abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
You do not take any professional interest in musical arts. You get none of the Bard abilities as you level up.
Your divine power is drawn from the font of life. You get all Life Domain Cleric abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
Your divine power is drawn from the font of light. You get all Light Domain Cleric abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
Your divine power is drawn from the font of wisdom. You get all Knowledge Domain Cleric abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
Your divine power is drawn from the font of guile. You get all Trickery Domain Cleric abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
Your divine power is drawn from the font of wilderness. You get all Nature Domain Cleric abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
You do not conform to a particular fighting style when it comes to combat. Stackable.
You do not conform to a particular fighting style when it comes to combat. Stackable.
Your divine power is drawn from the font of storms. You get all Tempest Domain Cleric abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
Your divine power is drawn from the font of battles. You get all War Domain Cleric abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
You do not draw power from any sacred font. You get none of the Cleric abilities as you level up.
You serve Bahamut, the dragon god of justice, and identify as one of his clerics.
You serve Mielikki, the goddess of forests, and identify as one of her clerics.
You serve Corellon Larethian, the elf god of art and magic, and identify as one of his clerics.
You serve Eilistraee, the drow goddess of beauty and freedom, and identify as one of her clerics.
You serve Garl Glittergold, the gnome god of luck, protection and trickery, and identify as one of his clerics.
You serve Gruumsh, the orc god of war, conquest, and victory at all costs, and identify as one of his clerics.
You serve Helm, the god of protection and guardians, and identify as one of his clerics.
You serve Ilmater, the god of endurance and suffering, and identify as one of his clerics.
You serve Kelemvor, the god of the dead, and identify as one of his clerics.
You serve Laduguer, the duergar god of hardships and tyranny, and identify as one of his clerics.
You serve Lathander, the god of birth, dawn and renewal, and identify as one of his clerics.
You serve Lolth, the drow goddess of spiders and betrayal, and identify as one of her clerics.
You serve Mystra, the goddess of magic, and identify as one of her clerics.
You serve Moradin, the dwarf god of creation, and identify as one of his clerics.
You serve Oghma, the god of knowledge, and identify as one of his clerics.
You serve Selûne, the goddess of the moon, and identify as one of her clerics.
You serve Talos, the god of storms and destruction, and identify as one of his clerics.
You serve Tempus, the god of war, and identify as one of his clerics.
You serve Tiamat, the dragon goddess of greed, and identify as one of her clerics.
You serve Tymora, the goddess of fortune, and identify as one of her clerics.
You serve Tyr, the god of law and justice, and identify as one of his clerics.
You serve Vlaakith, the lich queen of the githyanki, and identify as one of her clerics.
You do not serve any of the gods of Faerûn in any official capacity, although your actions may still further their causes regardless.
You serve Yondalla, the halfling goddess of fertility and protection, and identify as one of her clerics.
You bond with the spores that grinds away old life. You get all Circle of the Spores Druid abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
You bond with the mercurial moon that shifts in time. You get all Circle of the Moon Druid abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
You bond with the very land where life grows on. You get all Circle of the Land Druid abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
You are not interested in bonding with nature. You get none of the Druid abilities as you level up.
You employ a wide range of combat manoeuvres to achieve superiority on battlefields. You get all of Battle Master Fighter abilities as you level up.
You weave incantations to supplement your extensive martial expertise. You get all of Eldritch Knight Fighter abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
You trust your own martial training and employ overwhelming force in combat. You get all of Champion Fighter abilities as you level up.
Your magic is merely a supplement to your main focus. You get all cantrips and level one wizard spells at level 3, and all level 2 wizard spells at level 7.
You are confident in your current combat prowess that you don't see a point in further training. You get none of the Fighter abilities as you level up.
You seek to achieve harmony of your body and soul via martial arts training. You get all of Open Hand Monk abilities as you level up.
You seek to achieve the balance of elements within and without. You get all of Four Elements Monk abilities as you level up.
You find solace and calmness in the embrace of shadows. You get all of Shadow Monk abilities as you level up.
You reject the harsh mental introspection and physical trainings required for the monastic lifestyle. You get none of the Monk abilities as you level up.
You dedicate yourself to the cause of life preservation. You get all of Oath of the Ancients Paladin abilities and code as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
You dedicate yourself to the cause of justice. You get all of Oath of Devotion Paladin abilities and code as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
You dedicate yourself to the cause of punishment of evil. You get all of Oath of Vengeance Paladin abilities and code as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
You refuse to burden yourself with the weight of a cause. You get none of the Paladin abilities or code as you level up.
You will track down the most dangerous prey, even to the edge of the word. You get all of Hunter Ranger abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
You rely on your loyal animal companion to aid you in your hunt. You get all of Beast Maser Ranger abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
You stalk your prey from elusive shadows, ambushing them before they can even scream. You get all of Gloom Stalker Ranger abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
Why would you go out hunting when you can just buy best of your preys with money? You get none of the Ranger abilities as you level up.
You do not have a particular type of favoured enemies. Stackable
Circumstances might require you to go out to desolate places, but you still prefer your own home over the wild. Stackable
You do not have a particular type of favoured enemies. Stackable
You do not have a particular type of favoured enemies. Stackable
Circumstances might require you to go out to desolate places, but you still prefer your own home over the wild. Stackable
Circumstances might require you to go out to desolate places, but you still prefer your own home over the wild. Stackable
Your training isn't reserved for a specific type of threat. DO NOT choose this if you have chosen 'Tracking' in the previous section.
You prefer to rely on traditional means of defense instead of cunning tactics. DO NOT choose this if you have chosen 'Tracking' in the previous section.
You have mastered the art of taking possessions from someone without their notice. You get all of Thief Rogue abilities as you level up.

You combine magical and mundane tricks to perform burglaries that can't be explained by skill alone. You get all of Arcane Trickster Rogue abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
You are tasked with killing your targets quickly and cleanly, chivalric honor be damned. You get all of Assassin Rogue abilities as you level up.
You take great care to not let yourself fall on the wrong side of law. You get none of the Rogue abilities as you level up.
You do not feel particular alignment with any of the animals in this list. DO NOT choose this if you have chosen 'Wildheart' in the previous section.
Your blood is churned with the ancient forces of chaos. You get all of Wild Magic Sorcerer abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
Your descend from the great wyverns of history. You get all of Draconic Bloodline Sorcerer abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
Your blood contains the essence of primordial storms. You get all of Storm Sorcery Sorcerer abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
Your lineage does not bring particular magical powers. You get none of the Sorcerer abilities as you level up.
Your bloodline isn't related to the ancient dragons. DO NOT choose other options unless you have chosen 'Draconic Bloodline' in the previous section
You have not invested in the way of manipulating spells via metamagics. Stackable.
You have made a pact with a fiendish master. You get all of Fiend Warlock abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
You have not invested in the way of manipulating spells via metamagics. Stackable.
You have not invested in the way of manipulating spells via metamagics. Stackable.
You have not invested in the way of manipulating spells via metamagics. Stackable.
You have made a pact with a lord of fey across the stars. You get all of Archfey Warlock abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
You have made a pact with an eldritch being across the stars. You get all of Great Old One Warlock abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
You refuse to let otherworldly masters make a puppet of you. You get none of the Warlock abilities as you level up.
You will get 'Circle of Death' as your Warlock Mystic Arcanum choice at level 11.
You have not made a pact with otherworldly beings to get into their mysteries.
You will get 'Arcane Gate' as your Warlock Mystic Arcanum choice at level 11.
You will get 'Eyebite' as your Warlock Mystic Arcanum choice at level 11.
You will get 'Flesh to Stone' as your Warlock Mystic Arcanum choice at level 11.
You will get 'Create Undead' as your Warlock Mystic Arcanum choice at level 11.
You have not made a pact with otherworldly beings to get their boons.
You reject all eldritch influence over your soul and body. Stackable.
You reject all eldritch influence over your soul and body. Stackable.
You reject all eldritch influence over your soul and body. Stackable.
You reject all eldritch influence over your soul and body. Stackable.
You reject all eldritch influence over your soul and body. Stackable.
You reject all eldritch influence over your soul and body. Stackable.
You take a particular academic interest in the Abjuration School of Magic. You get all of Abjuration Wizard abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
You do not take particular interest in academic magic. You get none of the Wizard abilities as you level up.
You take a particular academic interest in the Conjuration School of Magic. You get all of Conjuration Wizard abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
You take a particular academic interest in the Divination School of Magic. You get all of Divination Wizard abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
You take a particular academic interest in the Enchantment School of Magic. You get all of Enchantment Wizard abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
You take a particular academic interest in the Evocation School of Magic. You get all of Evocation Wizard abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
You take a particular academic interest in the Illusion School of Magic. You get all of Illusion Wizard abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
You take a particular academic interest in the Necromancy School of Magic. You get all of Necromancy Wizard abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
You take a particular academic interest in the Transmutation School of Magic. You get all of Transmutation Wizard abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.

Affected entity has gained [1].

As long as it has its temporary hit points, its melee weapon attacks and unarmed strikes deal an additional [2], and it deals double damage with Halo of Spores.

Ends early if the entity uses Wild Shape.
The residual magic of your spells forms a ward around you that protects you from harm.

Each time you cast an Abjuration spell, the intensity of the ward increases by the amount of the spell's Level.

Each time you take damage, the ward blocks an amount of damage equal to its intensity, and its intensity decreases by [1].

After each Long Rest, the ward's intensity resets, and becomes the same as your wizard level.

Each time you take a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>, the intensity of your <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="ArcaneWard">Arcane Ward</LSTag> increases by an amount equal to your wizard level.
When you cast a spell of Level 1 or higher that deals Lightning or Thunder damage, you cause a small, local storm. All enemies within [2] take [1] or [3].
When you are hit by a melee attack, you deal [1] to the attacker and potentially push them away.
Gain [1] and deal an additional [2] while you have them. Cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_HaloOfSpores">Halo of Spores</LSTag> with double damage.
When you cast a spell of Level 1 or higher that deals Lightning damage, you cause a small, local storm. All enemies within [2] take [1].
Deal [1] and possibly push your attacker away.
Cause an eruption of electricity and lightning.
Draw on your stamina to heal yourself.

Regain half your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="KiPoint">Ki Points</LSTag> and enter a temporary state of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="WHOLENESS_OF_BODY">Wholeness</LSTag> where you regain ki points and have an extra bonus action.

Assume the shape of a giant badger that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Burrow_GiantBadger">Burrow</LSTag> into the ground. The badger has a starting health of [1] that increases every two druid levels.

Assume the shape of a polar bear that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_GoadingRoar_Bear_Summon">Goad</LSTag> enemies into attacking it. The polar bear has a starting health of [1] that increases every two druid levels.

Assume the shape of a deep rothé that casts <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_DancingLights">Dancing Lights</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Rush_Rush_DeepRothe">Charges</LSTag> its enemies. The deep rothé has a starting health of [1] that increases every two druid levels.
Assume the shape of a giant spider that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Web_Spider">Enweb</LSTag> enemies. The giant spider has a starting health of [1] that increases every two druid levels.

Assume the shape of a dire wolf that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_PackHowl_Wolf_Dire">Incite</LSTag> allies and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Bite_Wolf_Dire_Wildshape">Distract</LSTag> enemies. The dire wolf has a starting health of [1] that increases every two druid levels.

Take the shape of a sabre-toothed tiger that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_RipandShred_SaberTooth_Tiger">Shred Armour</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="REGENERATION_SABERTOOTH">regenerate</LSTag> hit points.
Your sabre-toothed tiger shape has a starting health of [1] that increases every two druid levels.
Take the shape of a panther that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Prowl_Panther">Prowl</LSTag> around invisibly.
Your panther shape has a starting health of [1] that increases every two druid levels.

Take the shape of a dilophosaurus whose <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_CorrosiveSpit_Dilophosaurus">Corrosive Spit</LSTag> can dissolve a target's <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag>.
Your dilophosaurus shape has a starting health of [1] that increases every two druid levels.

Take the shape of an owlbear that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Owlbear_Wildshape_Smash">Rupture</LSTag> the ground and become <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Owlbear_Wildshape_Enrage">Enraged</LSTag>.
Your owlbear shape has a starting health of [1] that increases every two druid levels.
Take the shape of an air myrmidon.

Your air myrmidon shape has a starting health of [1] that increases every two druid levels. It can cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Invisibility">Invisibility</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_LightningStrike_Myrmidon_Air">Electrified Flail</LSTag>, and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_RagingVortex_Myrmidon_Air">Raging Vortex</LSTag>.
Take the shape of an earth myrmidon.

Your earth myrmidon shape has a starting health of [1] that increases every two druid levels. It can cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_MetalCoating_Myrmidon_Earth">Muck to Metal</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_MudSlap_Myrmidon_Earth">Sludgy Sling</LSTag>, and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Burrow_Myrmidon_Earth">Burrow</LSTag>.
Take the shape of a fire myrmidon.

Your fire myrmidon shape has a starting health of [1] that increases every two druid levels. It can cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_FieryStrike_Myrmidon_Fire">Scorching Strike</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_BurningRage_Myrmidon_Fire">Myrmidon's Immolation</LSTag>, and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_RangedSwipe_Myrmidon_Fire">Cinderous Swipe</LSTag>.
Take the shape of a water myrmidon.

Your water myrmidon shape has a starting health of [1] that increases every two druid levels. It can cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_FreezingStrike_Myrmidon_Water">Hiemal Strike</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_HealingMist_Myrmidon_Water">Healing Vapours</LSTag>, and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_ExplosiveIcicle_Myrmidon_Water">Explosive Icicle</LSTag>.
While not in combat, regain half your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="KiPoint">Ki Points</LSTag> (rounded down).
Heal yourself and all nearby allies for [1]. Regain another [1] next turn.
Heal yourself and all nearby allies for [1]. Regain another [1] next turn.

Reduce the damage from a ranged weapon attack by 1d10 + your Dexterity Modifier + your monk level.

If the damage is reduced to 0, you use a Ki Point to Deflect the Missile.
You can only reduce damage from the attack - any additional effects can't be negated.

Inspire an ally to add a +[1] bonus to their next <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, weapon damage, or <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag>.
Summon a black bear that can endure heavy attacks and draw the enemy's attention with its <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_GoadingRoar_Bear_Summon">Goading Roar</LSTag>.
Summon a boar that can sweep through the battlefield and knock enemies off their feet with its <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Rush_Rush_Boar_Summon">Charge</LSTag>.

Summon a wolf spider that can shoot <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Web_Spider_Summon">Webs</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="POISONED">Poison</LSTag> enemies with its <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Bite_GiantSpider_Summon">Bite</LSTag>.
Summon a dire raven that can fly and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_RendVision_Raven_Summon">Blind</LSTag> its enemies.
Summon a wolf that can inflict devastating wounds and knock down enemies with its <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Bite_Wolf_Summon">Lunging Bite</LSTag>.
Use your blessed touch to heal a creature or cure it of all diseases and poisons.
Imbue your hands with divine power to heal a target.

Inspire an ally to add a +[1] bonus to their next <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag>, or <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>.
You prefer to rely on your other abilities instead of combat manoeuvres to achieve victory. Stackable
You prefer to rely on your other abilities instead of combat manoeuvres to achieve victory. Stackable
You prefer to rely on your other abilities instead of combat manoeuvres to achieve victory. Stackable
You prefer to rely on your other abilities instead of combat manoeuvres to achieve victory. Stackable
You prefer to rely on your other abilities instead of combat manoeuvres to achieve victory. Stackable
You prefer to rely on your other abilities instead of combat manoeuvres to achieve victory. Stackable
You prefer to rely on your other abilities instead of combat manoeuvres to achieve victory. Stackable
You have cultivated the essence of your alternate selves as a harmonious current of ki that flows within your body and your soul. You get all abilities of Open Hand Monk as you level up.
You have peered through the edge of fate and gained a piece of transcendental knowledge .
You forsake any external boost in favour of your inner strength.
Your muscles are imbued with extraordinary might. Your Strength Score is increased by 5.
Your muscles are imbued with supernatural might. Your Strength Score is increased by 10.
Your muscles are imbued with transcendental might. Your Strength Score is increased by 15.
You forsake any external boost in favour of your inner grace.
Your movements are imbued with extraordinary grace. Your Dexterity Score is increased by 5.
Your movements are imbued with supernatural grace. Your Dexterity Score is increased by 10.
Your movements are imbued with transcendental grace. Your Dexterity Score is increased by 15.
You forsake any external boost in favour of your inner fortitude.
Your physique is imbued with extraordinary grit. Your Constitution Score is increased by 5.
Your physique is imbued with supernatural grit. Your Constitution Score is increased by 10.
Your physique is imbued with transcendental grit. Your Constitution Score is increased by 15.
You forsake any external boost in favour of your inner reflection.
Your mind is imbued with extraordinary ingenuity. Your Intelligence Score is increased by 5.
Your mind is imbued with supernatural ingenuity. Your Intelligence Score is increased by 10.
Your mind is imbued with transcendental ingenuity. Your Intelligence Score is increased by 15.
You forsake any external boost in favour of your inner enlightenment.
Your psyche is imbued with extraordinary insight. Your Wisdom Score is increased by 5.
Your psyche is imbued with supernatural insight. Your Wisdom Score is increased by 10.
Your psyche is imbued with transcendental insight. Your Wisdom Score is increased by 15.
You forsake any external boost in favour of your inner peace.
Your aura is imbued with extraordinary brilliance. Your Charisma Score is increased by 5.
Your aura is imbued with supernatural brilliance. Your Charisma Score is increased by 10.
Your aura is imbued with transcendental brilliance. Your Charisma Score is increased by 15.
You can pull off several physical stunts out of your sleeves. You gain Proficiency in Athletics skill.
Your body is well-adjusted to any physical challenge in Faerûn. You gain Expertise in Athletics skill.
You stride difficult terrains with ease. You gain Proficiency in Acrobatics skill.
Your body balance and motor coordination edge on the supernatural. You gain Expertise in Acrobatics skill.
Your quick fingers can earn you a place in most Faerûnian thieves guild. You gain Proficiency in Sleight of Hand skill.
There is nothing in the world that is truly beyond your reach. You gain Expertise in Sleight of Hand skill.
You've learned the tricks of moving around in shadow without others' notice. You gain Proficiency in Stealth skill.
You can vanish into thin air in front of people's eyes. You gain Expertise in Stealth skill.
You can recognize most common forms of magic and enchantments. You gain Proficiency in Arcana skill.
You are well-learned in all manners of knowledge pertaining the Weave. You gain Expertise in Arcana skill.
You can recall most influential events in Faerûnian history. You gain Proficiency in History skill.
You can recall any obscure detail from the past, as long as it is recorded. You gain Expertise in History skill.
You have a keen eye for anything out of place in your environment. You gain Proficiency in Investigation skill.
You can reconstruct even the most complex schemes from the merest hint of clues. You gain Expertise in Investigation skill.
You can recognize most plants or animals on sight. You gain Proficiency in Nature skill.
People tend to seek your advice on exotic creatures and natural phenomena. You gain Expertise in Nature skill.
You are well-versed in the rites and creed of most common Faerûnian faiths. You gain Proficiency in Religion skill.
You know something about even the most esoteric ritual of an obscure cult in Faerûn. You gain Expertise in Religion skill.
You've learned the way of communicating basic emotions and information with animals. You gain Proficiency in Animal Handling skill.
You can calm the most ferocious beasts in the wild with ease. You gain Expertise in Animal Handling skill.
Your can sense the deeper meaning under façades. You gain Proficiency in Insight skill.
People with secrets to keep are instinctively terrified of looking at you in the eyes. You gain Expertise in Insight skill.
Your've learned deal with most common forms of injuries and diseases. You gain Proficiency in Medicine skill.
'Mundane' medical tools in your hands can heal better than divine magic. You gain Expertise in Medicine skill.
Your can catch any sensory anomaly even in the heat of a battle. You gain Proficiency in Perception skill.
Your can see what others cannot see, and hear what others cannot hear. You gain Expertise in Perception skill.
You've learned how to live a comfortable life beyond the reach of civilization. You gain Proficiency in Survival skill.
The wilds are home to you, and no one can trespass it without your notice. You gain Expertise in Survival skill.
You are sometimes called a con artist by your friends. You gain Proficiency in Deception skill.
There's no one that you cannot deceive, even yourself. You gain Expertise in Deception skill.
People are easily coerced into submission by your display of power. You gain Proficiency in Intimidation skill.
You've come to know that there's fear within every mortal's heart, even the one who call themselves fearless. You gain Expertise in Intimidation skill.
Your performance can attract a large crowd within any settlements. You gain Proficiency in Performance skill.
Your dances and songs touch can move even the gods themselves. You gain Expertise in Performance skill.
Your honeyed words can diffuse conflicts and calm the crowd. You gain Proficiency in Persuasion skill.
Your heartful plea can sway even the heart of stone. You gain Expertise in Persuasion skill.
Training Skills are so tiring! Why don't we play another round of dice?
What do you even need all that mastery for? Being trained is not enough?
Your instincts manifest through the terrifying might of the giants. You get all Giant Barbarian abilities as you level up.
Your interest lies in the capitivating charm and legends of the feys. You get all College of Glamour Bard abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
Your divine power is drawn from the font of mortality. You get all Death Domain Cleric abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
You bond with the shining stars that guide the tide of fate. You get all Circle of the Stars Druid abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
You rely on a curious combination of archery and arcane magic in combat. You get all of Arcane Archer Fighter abilities as you level up.
You find enlightenment in a state of elevated revelry. You get all of Drunken Master Monk abilities as you level up.
You dedicate yourself to the cause of upholding civilisation. You get all of Oath of the Crown Paladin abilities and code as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
You receive aid from a swarm of natural spirits in the pursuit of your prey. You get all of Swarmkeeper Ranger abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
You find yourself averse to the notion of a swarm of helpful insectile assistants. You already have a mindflayer parasite in your head, after all.
You employ a flurry of blade flicking and personal charm to deceive your targets. You get all of Swashbuckler Rogue abilities as you level up.
Your blood is connected to the darkness of the Shadowfell. You get all of Shadow Magic Sorcerer abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
You have made a pact with a mysterious sentient weapon from the Shadowfell. You get all of Hexblade Warlock abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
You take a particular academic interest in the elven tradition of bladesinging. You get all of Bladesinging Wizard abilities as you level up, spell slots and spells known excluded.
